extendedIngredients.name: potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: If you cannot find purple potatoes, sometimes called Peruvian purple potatoes or blue potatoes, just use a simple new potato instead.

extendedIngredients.name: i love the
extendedIngredients.original: I love the thin, flakey filet of trout for this dish, but you could use any flakey white fish. Tilapia or snapper would be especially nice.

title: French In A Flash: Purple Potato-crusted Trout A La Francaise
summary: The recipe French In A Flash: Purple Potato-crusted Trout A La Francaise could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in roughly 24 minutes. This recipe serves 7 and costs $3.4 per serving. One serving contains 349 calories, 27g of protein, and 26g of fat. 22 people have tried and liked this recipe. A couple people really liked this main course. Head to the store and pick up i love the, juice of lemon, lemon zest, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 77%. This score is good. Try French In A Flash: Trout En Papillotte, Stuffed Trout with Purple-Potato Gratin, and French in a Flash: Olivey French Lentil and Barley Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy are great choices for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. You could try Amelia Brut ros√© Cremant de Bordeaux. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Amelia Brut Rose Cremant de Bordeaux
productMatches.description: Amelia displays aromas and flavors of strawberry and red currant, with a medium body and elegant finish. A richness on the palate and fine bubbles result from vinification using the Method Traditionnelle and aging on the lees.
